entry.title: Combined summary - PPLNS with job declaration
entry.summary:
The mining community has expressed concerns regarding the potential manipulation of block rewards through the submission of fake block templates with disproportionately high fees. To counteract this, it has been suggested that all block templates be verified rigorously by a pool or a designated Job Declarator server entity (JDS). This process involves comparing the transactions in the template against those in the JDS's mempool to ensure the absence of unspendable big fee transactions. A proposed solution to mitigate the risk of such fraudulent activities includes capping fees for all slices to the fees found in the previously accepted block. This approach aims to disincentivize the creation of templates with inflated values and encourages the distribution of valuable transactions across the network.

These conversations reflect a broader context of ongoing efforts to optimize and secure cryptocurrency mining operations, underscoring the importance of collaboration, innovation, and rigorous analysis in navigating the challenges faced by the mining community.
